description: Google Gemini model pricing configuration - Official pricing from ai.google.dev

gemini-3-pro-preview.description: Gemini 3 Pro Preview - Most advanced multimodal model (prices for prompts > 200K tokens)

gemini-2.5-pro.description: Gemini 2.5 Pro - Advanced multi-purpose model for coding and complex reasoning (prices for prompts > 200K tokens)

gemini-2.5-flash.description: Gemini 2.5 Flash - Mixed reasoning model with 1M context and thinking budget (audio input pricing)

gemini-2.5-flash-preview.description: Gemini 2.5 Flash Preview - Latest preview of 2.5 Flash model

gemini-2.5-flash-preview-09-2025.description: Gemini 2.5 Flash Preview (Sept 2025) - Best for high-volume tasks with thinking

gemini-2.5-flash-lite.description: Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite - Smallest and most cost-effective model for scale (audio input pricing)

gemini-2.5-flash-lite-preview.description: Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite Preview - Latest preview version

gemini-2.5-flash-lite-preview-09-2025.description: Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite Preview (Sept 2025) - Optimized for cost-efficiency and throughput

gemini-2.5-computer-use-preview-10-2025.description: Gemini 2.5 Computer Use - Optimized for browser automation agents (prices for prompts > 200K tokens)

gemini-2.0-flash.description: Gemini 2.0 Flash - Balanced multimodal model with 1M context, built for agentic era (audio input pricing)

gemini-2.0-flash-exp.description: Gemini 2.0 Flash Experimental - Latest experimental variant

gemini-2.0-flash-thinking-exp.description: Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking Experimental - Extended reasoning capabilities

gemini-2.0-flash-lite.description: Gemini 2.0 Flash-Lite - Smallest and most cost-effective model for scale

gemini-robotics-er-1.5-preview.description: Gemini Robotics-ER 1.5 - Embodied reasoning for robotics (audio input pricing)

gemma-3n.description: Gemma 3n - Open model optimized for on-device performance, completely free

modelFamilyPatterns.description: IMPORTANT: Pattern ordering matters! More specific patterns MUST come before less specific ones.
modelFamilyPatterns.description2: Example: '^gemini-2\.5-flash-lite' must be before '^gemini-2\.5-flash' to prevent incorrect matches.
modelFamilyPatterns.description3: When adding new patterns, place more specific variants (with suffixes like -lite, -thinking, -exp) BEFORE their base variants.

modelFamilyPatterns.description: Gemini 3 Pro variants - most advanced multimodal model family
Gemini 2.5 Pro variants - advanced multi-purpose model family
Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite variants - most cost-effective model family
Gemini 2.5 Flash variants - mixed reasoning model family
Gemini 2.5 Computer Use variants - browser automation agents
Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking variants - extended reasoning capabilities
Gemini 2.0 Flash variants - balanced multimodal model family
Gemini Robotics variants - embodied reasoning for robotics
Gemma 3n variants - open model for on-device

notes: ⚠️  PATTERN ORDERING: modelFamilyPatterns array order is critical! More specific patterns MUST come before less specific ones to prevent incorrect matches.
Pricing from official Google AI pricing page: https://ai.google.dev/pricing (as of 2025-11-22)
All prices are in USD per 1 million tokens
Prices shown are for HIGHEST tier when tiered pricing exists (e.g., prompts > 200K tokens)
Some models have tiered pricing based on prompt length - check official docs for details
Audio input pricing is typically higher than text/image/video - prices shown use audio rates where applicable
Gemini 3 Pro: $2.00/$4.00 input, $12.00/$18.00 output (based on prompt length)
Gemini 2.5 Pro: $1.25/$2.50 input, $10.00/$15.00 output (based on prompt length)
Gemini 2.5 Flash: $0.30/$1.00 input, $2.50 output (text vs audio input)
Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite: $0.10/$0.30 input, $0.40 output (text vs audio input)
Gemini 2.0 Flash: $0.10/$0.70 input, $0.40 output (text vs audio input)
Free tier available for many models with rate limits - see official pricing page
Context caching and grounding tools have additional charges - not reflected in these base prices
Gemma models are completely free and open source
Batch processing can reduce costs by 50% for supported models
Image generation, TTS, and other specialized variants have different pricing structures
